page.title: 02THE HALL EAST CARLTON
page.content: This fine building was erected in 1868 by Sir Geoffrey Palmer on the site of an old farmhouse. There are eight ground floor rooms.The galleried hall has a large staircase leading to thirty bedrooms. Outside is a stable block, an ice house(cylindrical and lined with brick) and the Coach House now converted to a museum. In the 1930's the British Steel Corporation (then Stewart and Lloyds) bought the hall for executives who had moved to work in Corby. At this time a number of air raid shelters were dug into the ground around the house. B.S.C. then sold the estate to Corby Council which kept visiting students there. Now a private enterprise has renovated it for use as an hotel or restaurant.
